_metadata.description: Exercise seed data for anatomy explorer database
notes: Import script should resolve mesh_id to structure_id
Bilateral structures use base name without .l/.r suffix
Involvement: primary (main mover), secondary (assist), stabilizer, stretched
v1.1 adds rehabilitation/prehab exercises targeting stabilizing muscles

exercises.name: Prone Y-Raise
exercises.description: Lie face-down with arms extended overhead in a Y position. Lift arms toward ceiling while squeezing shoulder blades. Focus on lower trapezius activation.

exercises.name: Prone T-Raise
exercises.description: Lie face-down with arms extended to sides forming a T. Lift arms toward ceiling squeezing shoulder blades together. Targets middle trapezius and rhomboids.

exercises.name: Prone W-Raise
exercises.description: Lie face-down with elbows bent at 90 degrees forming a W shape. Lift hands toward ceiling while externally rotating shoulders. Excellent for rotator cuff.

exercises.name: Wall Slide
exercises.description: Stand with back and arms against wall. Slide arms overhead maintaining contact with wall. Promotes proper scapular mechanics and serratus activation.

exercises.name: Serratus Wall Push
exercises.description: Stand facing wall with arms straight, hands on wall. Push into wall to protract shoulder blades, then relax. Isolates serratus anterior.

exercises.name: Scapular Push-Up
exercises.description: In push-up position, keep arms straight. Let shoulder blades pinch together, then push through to protract them. No elbow bend.

exercises.name: Banded Pull-Apart
exercises.description: Hold band at shoulder width, arms extended. Pull band apart by squeezing shoulder blades. Excellent for postural correction.

exercises.name: Side-Lying External Rotation
exercises.description: Lie on side with elbow at 90 degrees against ribs. Rotate forearm upward keeping elbow fixed. Isolates external rotators without compensation.

exercises.name: Prone Swimmer
exercises.description: Lie face-down, alternate lifting opposite arm and leg in swimming motion. Promotes shoulder stability through range of motion.

exercises.name: Banded External Rotation at 90
exercises.description: Arm at 90 degrees abduction, elbow at 90 degrees. Rotate forearm from parallel to floor to perpendicular. High-level rotator cuff work.

exercises.name: Banded Internal Rotation at 90
exercises.description: Arm at 90 degrees abduction, elbow at 90 degrees. Rotate forearm from perpendicular to parallel with floor. Targets subscapularis.

exercises.name: Supraspinatus Raise (Empty Can)
exercises.description: Raise arm at 30 degrees forward of side (scapular plane) with thumb down. Isolates supraspinatus for rotator cuff strengthening.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Balance
exercises.description: Stand on one leg maintaining balance for time. Progress by closing eyes. Builds ankle proprioception and hip stability.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Balance on Unstable Surface
exercises.description: Stand on one leg on BOSU or foam pad. Greatly increases proprioceptive demand on ankle and foot intrinsics.

exercises.name: Short Foot Exercise
exercises.description: While standing, draw toes toward heel without curling toes, lifting arch. Activates foot intrinsic muscles for arch support.

exercises.name: Toe Yoga
exercises.description: Practice lifting big toe while keeping small toes down, then reverse. Improves neural control of foot intrinsics.

exercises.name: Towel Toe Curl
exercises.description: Place towel under foot, curl toes to gather towel toward heel. Strengthens toe flexors and foot intrinsics.

exercises.name: Banded Ankle Eversion
exercises.description: With band around forefoot, turn sole of foot outward against resistance. Strengthens ankle evertors to prevent sprains.

exercises.name: Banded Ankle Inversion
exercises.description: With band around forefoot anchored to side, turn sole of foot inward against resistance. Strengthens tibialis posterior.

exercises.name: Clamshell
exercises.description: Lie on side with knees bent. Keep feet together while lifting top knee. Isolates gluteus medius and hip external rotators.

exercises.name: Banded Clamshell
exercises.description: Clamshell with band around thighs for added resistance. Progressive overload for hip abductors.

exercises.name: Side-Lying Hip Abduction
exercises.description: Lie on side with legs straight. Lift top leg toward ceiling keeping it straight. Pure gluteus medius isolation.

exercises.name: Terminal Knee Extension
exercises.description: With band behind knee, start with slight knee bend. Straighten knee fully against band resistance. Targets VMO for knee stability.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Calf Raise
exercises.description: Standing on one leg, raise heel as high as possible. Builds calf strength and ankle stability unilaterally.
